net.kemuri9.gradle.mrjar

Interface MRJarExtension


  • public interface MRJarExtension
    Extension for defining the behavior and layout of the Multi-release Jar

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addLanguage(LanguageSupport support)
      Add a new LanguageSupport to recognize other JVM-based languages
      void addVersion(Object version, Action<? super Version> configure)
      Add a JVM version to the multi-release jar

      Perform a configuration on all added configured Versions

      Perform a configuration on all configured Versions.

      Perform a configuration on the base or "main" version of code
      Property<Boolean> getIncludeBaseTests()
      State of the tests for all added versions also including the "main" tests.
      Map<String,LanguageSupport> getLanguages()
      Retrieve the current registered languages
      Property<Boolean> getMultireleaseSourceJar()
      State of the source jar being multi-release, similar to the compiled code jar
      Property<Boolean> getUseJarInTests()
      State of the tests utilizing the Jar instead of the class files directly.
      Property<Boolean> getUseToolchain()
      State of all tasks using version specific Java toolchains to perform the tasks with

    • Method Detail

      • addLanguage

        void addLanguage(LanguageSupport support)
        Add a new LanguageSupport to recognize other JVM-based languages
        Parameters:
        support - LanguageSupport to recognize

      • addVersion

        void addVersion(Object version,
                Action<? super Version> configure)
        Add a JVM version to the multi-release jar
        Parameters:
        version - version or "release" of Java to add to the jar. This can be any value that JavaVersion.toVersion(Object) supports
        configure - Action indicating the configuration of Version

      • allAddedVersions

        void allAddedVersions(Action<? super Version> configure)
        Perform a configuration on all added configured Versions
        Parameters:
        configure - Action indicating the configuration to apply on all current added Versions

      • allVersions

        void allVersions(Action<? super Version> configure)
        Perform a configuration on all configured Versions. This will not configure the "base" version if it has not already been configured at least once.
        Parameters:
        configure - Action indicating the configuration to apply on all current Versions

      • baseVersion

        void baseVersion(Action<? super Version> configure)
        Perform a configuration on the base or "main" version of code
        Parameters:
        configure - Action indicating the configuration to apply on the main version

      • getIncludeBaseTests

        @Input
Property<Boolean> getIncludeBaseTests()
        State of the tests for all added versions also including the "main" tests.
        Returns:
        Property for the state of the version centric tests using the "main" tests.

      • getLanguages

        @Internal
Map<String,LanguageSupport> getLanguages()
        Retrieve the current registered languages
        Returns:
        current registered languages

      • getMultireleaseSourceJar

        @Input
Property<Boolean> getMultireleaseSourceJar()
        State of the source jar being multi-release, similar to the compiled code jar
        Returns:
        Property for the state of the source jar being multi-release

      • getUseJarInTests

        @Input
Property<Boolean> getUseJarInTests()
        State of the tests utilizing the Jar instead of the class files directly. For some scenarios where module definitions are provided, the version of a class file desired to be tested may not be able to be tested directly due to module patching behaviors. So instead of testing class files, test the actual multi-release Jar.
        Returns:
        Property for the state of the tests using the Jar in testing.

      • getUseToolchain

        @Input
Property<Boolean> getUseToolchain()
        State of all tasks using version specific Java toolchains to perform the tasks with
        Returns:
        state of all tasks using version specific Java toolchains to perform the tasks with
